segments.text: I notice the boy balancing on that stool, and it makes my heart race.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s so focused on the cookies that he doesn’t even see how unstable he is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is watching him, her eyes full of anticipation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s hoping he’ll share, but he might not even notice her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water from the sink is just pouring out, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is polishing that plate like it’s the only thing that matters right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t turned around yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and soon the whole kitchen will be a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the children will get in trouble when she finally notices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm, like nothing is wrong at all.
segments.speaker: PAR
